texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: To enable SSL/TLS support in proftpd, add the following to the proftpd.conf file:
texts.text: To enable SSL/TLS support in proftpd, add the following to the proftpd.conf file:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
<IfModule mod_tls.c>
    TLSEngine on
    TLSLog /var/ftpd/tls.log
    TLSRequired off
    TLSRSACertificateFile /usr/share/ssl/certs/server.crt
    TLSRSACertificateKeyFile /usr/share/ssl/private/server.key
    TLSCACertificateFile /usr/share/ssl/certs/cacert.crt
    TLSVerifyClient off
    TLSRenegotiate required off
</IfModule>
texts.text:
<IfModule mod_tls.c>
    TLSEngine on
    TLSLog /var/ftpd/tls.log
    TLSRequired off
    TLSRSACertificateFile /usr/share/ssl/certs/server.crt
    TLSRSACertificateKeyFile /usr/share/ssl/private/server.key
    TLSCACertificateFile /usr/share/ssl/certs/cacert.crt
    TLSVerifyClient off
    TLSRenegotiate required off
</IfModule>

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: To  require  SSL/TLS on all connections, change
texts.text: To  require  SSL/TLS on all connections, change

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: to  on . Of course, replace the certificate, key, and CA certificate (if applicable) to the correct files on your system.
texts.text: to  on . Of course, replace the certificate, key, and CA certificate (if applicable) to the correct files on your system.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Once you're all done, close your FTP connection and make a new one. There is no need to restart xinetd.
texts.text: Once you're all done, close your FTP connection and make a new one. There is no need to restart xinetd.
